poem:
Title: "Sorrow's Silent Summons"

A captured sun in their eyes,
Returned as ghosts 'neath a Middle Eastern sky.
The shadows of Norway's dreams mend, 
Mirrored in each vital gram of aid dispensed.

Doubt dances on the edge of innocence,
A saga spun amidst silence and evidence.
Ah, may the call of peace swirl,
Tracing sand-tales of a troubled world.
